sections.title: Disclosure of Interests in Other Entities
sections.description: Checklist for presentation and disclosure requirements under IFRS 12.

items.question: Does the entity disclose information about significant judgements and assumptions it has made (and changes to those judgements and assumptions) in determining that it has control of another entity, i.e., an investee?

Does the entity include under the significant judgements and assumptions disclosed in IFRS 12.7 those made when changes in facts and circumstances are such that the conclusion about whether it has control changes during the reporting period?
Does the entity disclose significant judgements and assumptions made in determining that it does not control another entity even though it holds more than half of the voting rights of that entity?
Does the entity disclose significant judgements and assumptions made in determining that it controls another entity even though it holds less than half of the voting rights of that entity?
Does the entity disclose significant judgements and assumptions made in determining that it is an agent or a principal?

Does the entity disclose enough information to understand the composition of the group, including the group’s composition and the interest that non-controlling interests have in the group’s activities and cash flows?
Does the entity disclose enough information to evaluate the nature and extent of significant restrictions on its ability to access or use group assets and to settle group liabilities?
Does the entity disclose enough information to evaluate the nature of, and changes in, the risks associated with its interests in consolidated structured entities?
Does the entity disclose enough information to evaluate the consequences of changes in its ownership interest in a subsidiary that do not result in a loss of control?
Does the entity disclose enough information to evaluate the consequences of losing control of a subsidiary during the reporting period?
When a subsidiary’s financial statements used for consolidation are as of a different date or for a different period, does the entity disclose the date of that subsidiary’s reporting period?
When a subsidiary’s financial statements used for consolidation are as of a different date or for a different period, does the entity disclose the reason for using that different date or period?
Does the entity disclose the name of each subsidiary with material non-controlling interests?
Does the entity disclose the principal place of business (and country of incorporation, if different) of each subsidiary with material non-controlling interests?
Does the entity disclose the proportion of ownership interests held by non-controlling interests in each subsidiary?
Does the entity disclose the proportion of voting rights held by non-controlling interests, if different from the proportion of ownership interests?
Does the entity disclose dividends paid to non-controlling interests in each subsidiary?

Does the entity disclose summarised financial information for each subsidiary with material non-controlling interests, including current assets, non-current assets, current liabilities, non-current liabilities, revenue, profit or loss and total comprehensive income?
Does the entity disclose restrictions that limit a parent or its subsidiaries from transferring cash or other assets to or from other group entities?
Does the entity disclose guarantees or other requirements that may restrict dividends, capital distributions, loans or advances between group entities?
Does the entity disclose the nature and extent to which protective rights of non-controlling interests can restrict access to or use of group assets and settlement of group liabilities?
Does the entity disclose the carrying amounts in its consolidated financial statements of the assets and liabilities subject to those restrictions?
Does the entity present a schedule showing the effects on equity attributable to owners of the parent of any changes in its ownership interest in a subsidiary that do not result in a loss of control?
When an entity loses control of a subsidiary, does it disclose the gain or loss calculated in accordance with IFRS 10.25?
When an entity loses control of a subsidiary, does it disclose the line item(s) in profit or loss in which the gain or loss is recognised if not presented separately?
When a parent determines that it is an investment entity in accordance with IFRS 10.27, does it disclose significant judgements and assumptions made in making that determination?
If the investment entity lacks one or more typical characteristics (see IFRS 10.28), does it disclose its reasons for concluding that it is nevertheless an investment entity?
When an entity becomes or ceases to be an investment entity, does it disclose the change in status and the reasons for the change?
When an entity becomes an investment entity, does it disclose the total fair value, as of the date of change of status, of the subsidiaries that cease to be consolidated?
When an entity becomes an investment entity, does it disclose the total gain or loss, if any, calculated in accordance with IFRS 10.B101?
When an entity becomes an investment entity, does it disclose the line item(s) in profit or loss in which the gain or loss is recognised if not presented separately?
Does an investment entity that applies the consolidation exception and accounts for a subsidiary at fair value through profit or loss disclose that fact?
For each unconsolidated subsidiary, does an investment entity disclose the subsidiary’s name?
For each unconsolidated subsidiary, does an investment entity disclose the principal place of business (and country of incorporation, if different)?
For each unconsolidated subsidiary, does an investment entity disclose the proportion of ownership interest held and, if different, the proportion of voting rights held?
If an investment entity is the parent of another investment entity, does it provide the disclosures in IFRS 12.19B for investments controlled by its investment entity subsidiary?

Does an investment entity disclose the nature and extent of any significant restrictions on an unconsolidated subsidiary’s ability to transfer funds to the investment entity as dividends or to repay loans or advances?
Does an investment entity disclose any current commitments or intentions to provide financial or other support to an unconsolidated subsidiary, including assistance in obtaining financial support?

If, without contractual obligation, an investment entity or its subsidiaries provided support to an unconsolidated subsidiary, does it disclose the type and amount of support provided to each subsidiary?
If, without contractual obligation, an investment entity or its subsidiaries provided support to an unconsolidated subsidiary, does it disclose the reasons for providing that support?

Does an investment entity disclose the terms of any contractual arrangements that could require it or its unconsolidated subsidiaries to provide financial support to a controlled structured entity, including events or circumstances that could expose it to a loss?

If, without contractual obligation, an investment entity or its unconsolidated subsidiaries provided support to a structured entity they did not control and that support resulted in control, does the entity disclose an explanation of the factors leading to that decision?
Does the entity disclose significant judgements and assumptions made in determining that it has joint control of an arrangement?
Does the entity disclose significant judgements and assumptions made in determining the type of joint arrangement (joint operation or joint venture) when structured through a separate vehicle?
Does the entity include under those judgements and assumptions any made when changes in facts and circumstances cause the conclusion about joint control to change during the reporting period?

Does the entity disclose information to evaluate the nature, extent and financial effects of its interests in joint arrangements, including the nature and effects of its contractual relationship with other investors with joint control?
Does the entity disclose information to evaluate the nature of, and changes in, the risks associated with its interests in joint ventures?
For each material joint arrangement, does the entity disclose the name of the joint arrangement?
For each material joint arrangement, does the entity describe the nature of its relationship with the arrangement (e.g., nature of activities and strategic importance)?
For each material joint arrangement, does the entity disclose the principal place of business (and country of incorporation, if different)?
For each material joint arrangement, does the entity disclose the proportion of ownership interest or participating share and, if different, the proportion of voting rights held?
For each material joint venture, does the entity disclose whether the investment is measured using the equity method or at fair value?

For each material joint venture, does the entity disclose financial information including dividends received and summarised financial information (current assets, non-current assets, current liabilities, non-current liabilities, revenue, profit or loss, depreciation and amortisation, interest income, interest expense, income tax expense or income), and, if equity-accounted, fair value if a quoted market price exists?
Does the summarised financial information reflect the amounts in the joint venture’s IFRS financial statements and not the entity’s share of those amounts?
If equity-accounted, are the joint venture’s IFRS statement amounts adjusted for fair value adjustments at acquisition and accounting policy differences?
Does the entity provide a reconciliation of the summarised financial information to the carrying amount of its interest in the joint venture?
If the entity measures its interest in a joint venture at fair value, does it disclose the basis on which the summarised financial information has been prepared?

If the joint venture does not prepare IFRS financial statements and preparation is impracticable or costly, does the entity disclose the basis on which the summarised financial information has been prepared?
Does the entity disclose, in aggregate, the carrying amount of its interests in all individually immaterial joint ventures accounted for using the equity method?
Does the entity disclose the aggregate share of profit or loss from continuing operations for all individually immaterial joint ventures?
Does the entity disclose the aggregate share of post-tax profit or loss from discontinued operations for all individually immaterial joint ventures?
Does the entity disclose the aggregate share of other comprehensive income for all individually immaterial joint ventures?
Does the entity disclose the aggregate share of total comprehensive income for all individually immaterial joint ventures?
Does the entity disclose, separately from other commitments, unrecognised commitments to contribute funding or resources that may give rise to future outflows?
Does the entity disclose, separately from other commitments, unrecognised commitments to acquire another party’s ownership interest in a joint venture if a specified event occurs or does not occur?

Does the entity disclose contingent liabilities relating to its interests in joint ventures, including its share of jointly incurred contingent liabilities, separately from other contingent liabilities?
Does the entity disclose the nature and extent of significant restrictions on joint ventures’ ability to transfer funds as dividends or to repay loans or advances?
Does the entity disclose when a joint venture’s financial statements used for equity accounting are as of a date or for a period different from the entity’s?
Does the entity disclose significant judgements and assumptions made in determining if it has significant influence over another entity?
Does the entity include under those judgements and assumptions any made when facts or circumstances change such that the conclusion about significant influence changes during the reporting period?
Does the entity disclose significant judgements and assumptions made in determining that it does not have significant influence even though it holds 20% or more of the voting rights?
Does the entity disclose significant judgements and assumptions made in determining that it has significant influence even though it holds less than 20% of the voting rights?

Does the entity disclose information to evaluate the nature, extent and financial effects of its interests in associates, including the nature and effects of its contractual relationship with other investors with significant influence?
Does the entity disclose information to evaluate the nature of, and changes in, the risks associated with its interests in associates?
For each material associate, does the entity disclose the associate’s name?
For each material associate, does the entity describe the nature of its relationship with the associate (e.g., nature of activities and strategic importance)?
For each material associate, does the entity disclose the principal place of business (and country of incorporation, if different)?
For each material associate, does the entity disclose the proportion of ownership interest or participating share and, if different, the proportion of voting rights held?
For each material associate, does the entity disclose whether the investment is measured using the equity method or at fair value?
If the associate is equity-accounted, does the entity disclose the fair value of its investment if there is a quoted market price?
Does the summarised financial information reflect the amounts in the associate’s IFRS financial statements and not the entity’s share of those amounts?
If equity-accounted, are the associate’s IFRS statement amounts adjusted for fair value adjustments at acquisition and accounting policy differences?
Does the entity provide a reconciliation of the summarised financial information to the carrying amount of its interest in the associate?

If the entity presents information on the basis of the associate’s financial statements because it measures the investment at fair value or preparation of IFRS statements is impracticable, does it disclose the basis on which the summarised information has been prepared?
Does the entity disclose, in aggregate, the carrying amount of its interests in all individually immaterial associates accounted for using the equity method?
